channel.title: (PI) Compiler/Run
channel.description:
Hello there, I have some problems with my compiler/Run on the source and Client.. I normally use Eclipse. However, I've decided to go classic on this one... Here's my compiler and run [Insidiax v2]
Codes:
Compiler: [CODE] @echo off javac -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause [/CODE] Some old based compiler.... anyone know's a new code, a better compiler for this?! Run: [CODE] @echo off title InsidiaX java -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server [/CODE] This is the run... pretty old sh*t... anyways, I was wondering if anyone could help with this... I'll post my errors now...
Compiler error: [CODE] http://prntscr.com/72ihil [/CODE]
Run.bat won't even open, when it does, it takes less than a second to close.... it auto closes within half a second.

item.title: (PI) Compiler/Run
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:551393”]Again, you could add your environmental variables and then just use “javac” instead of defining the path to the .exe in every compiler.
And for running you can use “java” or “javaw” (depending on what needs to run).[/quote]
THanks!

Read full topic

item.title: (PI) Compiler/Run
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Again, you could add your environmental variables and then just use “javac” instead of defining the path to the .exe in every compiler.
And for running you can use “java” or “javaw” (depending on what needs to run).

Read full topic

item.title: (PI) Compiler/Run
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“Ikthat, post:2, topic:551393”]for the run.bat under

java -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server

add

with the compiler change the start to this, so delete “javac” and right before -classpath, where javac really was, add this:

so your compiler should look like

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_45\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

You may need to replace your jdk version, so replace “jdk1.8.0_45” with your current version. So for example yours could be like “jdk1.7.0_79”. You can find out your jdk by going to C Drive -> Program Files -> Java -> And you will find a JDK file with the suffix like “1.8.0_45”. If you have Program Files X86, then you may need to change "Program Files/"
to “Program Files (x86)/”

Hope this helped.[/quote]
THANKYOU!THANKYOU!THANKYOU!

Read full topic

item.title: (PI) Compiler/Run
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You’re missing your Environmental Variables.
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/essential/environment/paths.html

Read full topic

item.title: (PI) Compiler/Run
item.dc:creator: @Ikthat Ikthat
item.description:
@Ikthat wrote:

for the run.bat under

java -Xmx1000m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server

add

with the compiler change the start to this, so delete “javac” and right before -classpath, where javac really was, add this:

so your compiler should look like

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_45\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

You may need to replace your jdk version, so replace “jdk1.8.0_45” with your current version. So for example yours could be like “jdk1.7.0_79”. You can find out your jdk by going to C Drive -> Program Files -> Java -> And you will find a JDK file with the suffix like “1.8.0_45”. If you have Program Files X86, then you may need to change "Program Files/"
to “Program Files (x86)/”

Hope this helped.

Read full topic
